scenarioDescription:
The EPIC 201757695 Exoplanetary System


Overview

EPIC 201757695 is a star with 0.73 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.66 times its radius. It is located NaN light years away from the solar system.

EPIC 201757695 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the EPIC 201757695 system


EPIC 201757695 b

EPIC 201757695 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2020-08, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of EPIC 201757695 b is 0.690 times the mass of Earth. The radius of EPIC 201757695 b is 0.908 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, EPIC 201757695 b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system EPIC 201757695, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: EPIC 201757695 - System With 1 Exoplanet
